title: January 31
description:
Lucie spent this week in Boston for work, yet again. We're all pretty tired of it. Dean took every chance to remind Lucie, trapped in Boston's cold and slush, that last week's rains had stopped and the sun was gently bathing Berkeley in a warming golden glow.

Austin came for a few days midweek to help out Dean. It was fun: Dean doesn't usually have a competitive soul in the house. The tournament on the Nintendo Wii balance board was FEROCIOUS.

Felix and Milo are both getting into their karate and soccer classes, respectively. The family definitely feels older, what with both kids into extracurricular activities.

children.title: Boston Snow
children.description: Lucie asked the client to take a photo of the San Francisco team in the snow to prove the folks back in sunny California that the white stuff was really falling right outside our office.

children.title: Snow Eaters
children.description: Brian, Leah and Lucie catching snow flakes on their tongues.

children.title: Evan Card
children.description:
Felix drew a card for Evan with flying presents and lots of !!!!!!!!!!!!!

The slumber party at Evan's featured a lively Nerf gun fight.

children.title: Karate
children.description: Felix is loving his karate class. We hear our dojo is actually teaching Cuong Nhu, a Vietnamese martial art that looks like, smells like and feels like karate but for a few nuances. We'll keep calling it karate.

children.title: Pomegranate
children.description:
While Lucie was in Boston, Austin spent two days at the house, helping Dean take care of the kids (thanks!)

They were regular Martha Stewarts: not only did Dean experiment with new ways of cooking fish sticks, Austin showcased a novel approach to de-seeding a pomegranate.

children.title: Bocci
children.description:
For such a little fella, Milo won a surprising number of rounds of our weekend bocci ball tournament.

Dean, however, cleaned up in the foursquare competition. No matter how hard he tried to lose.

children.title: Final Chapter
children.description:
This weekend we finished Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (book 2).

The thrilling last chapter unfolded in a civilized fashion, over coffee and hot chocolate.
